author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs
Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 4th February 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe Worship and Communion led by Revd John Mackerness
00:00:00 - Music before the service
04:43 - Entry of the bible
05:06 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
08:55 - Call to worship
09:50 - 12:24 - Hymn: Sing praise to the Lord (R&S 49) Tune: Laudate Dominum)
12:34 - 16:07 - Intro to theme: What makes you feel better when you‚Äôre feeling down? What makes people feel better when feeling down, with answers like music and chocolate. Favorite hymns and films that lift their spirits when down. What makes us feel better needs to be the right remedy for the situation. One of the best ways to help people feel better is to care for them and show love. Caring for yourself when a carer TV and radio provide comfort but don't replace real company. Jesus was very concerned for the weak and ill. People were always looking for Jesus, but he would withdraw to pray and recharge. These words can help discover the healing that comes through faith in God. Things that can make people feel better when they are down, from music to care and company, noting that the remedy should fit the need. Jesus' practice of withdrawing from demanding crowds to pray and renew his spirit to serve others.
16:13 - 18:09 - Prayers
18:17 - 21:50 - Hymn: All my hope on God is founded (R&S 586) Tune: Michael
22:10 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing ‚Äì the Lord be with you; and also with you: Amen) or there are activities at back of church.
22:30 - Offering prayer
22:55 - Introduction to the readings
23:27 - 25:02 - Reading: 1 Corinthians 9: 16 ‚Äì 23 read by Lesley 25:14 - 26:41 - Reading: Mark 1:29-39 read by Ian
26:58 - 30:01 - Hymn: The King of Love my Shepherd is (R&S 552) Tune: Dominus regit me
30:19 - 45:53 - Sermon: ‚ÄúA rich feast‚Äù followed by short time of silence The Old Testament and Psalm readings portray God as great, caring for people in exile. The gospel shows Jesus healing and taking time to pray and listen to God. We can experience healing by knowing God loves and cares for us. Paul says preaching the gospel is compelled by God, not something to boast about. Working at the airport learning other ways to share faith. Actions can preach, but words are still needed to share the hope within us. Short conversations can lead to emotional healing by changing perspectives. God still sustains the weak and powerless today through Jesus. We are called to proclaim in word and deed the message of new life in Christ.
45:56 - 49:07 - Prayers of Intercession and The Lord‚Äôs Prayer
49:09 - The peace ‚Ä¶The peace of the risen Christ be always with you. And also with you. Alleluia!
49:37 - 52:22 - Communion Hymn: Brother, sister, let me serve you (R&S 474) Tune: Servant song
53:24 - 01:04:49 - Communion
01:04:56 - 01:07:34 - Hymn: Christ for the world! We sing (R&S 599) Tune: Moscow
01:08:33 - 01:09:10 - Blessing
01:10:04 - 01:13:26 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications üîî when we post new services. - Like our services ‚ù§Ô∏è or leave a comment on your favourite ones. üôè - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. üîÑ

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 28th January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications üîî when we post new services. - Like our services ‚ù§Ô∏è or leave a comment on your favourite ones. üôè - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. üîÑ
00:00 - Music before the service
03:57 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
04:18 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
06:48 - Call to worship Psalm 111. 1 ‚Äì 10
08:22 - Hymn - 187 O worship the Lord in the beauty of Holiness
11:32 - 14:44 - Prayer of adoration and confession Lord‚Äôs Prayer
15:12 - 16:13 - Reading: Mark 1. 21 ‚Äì 28 read by Linda Curley
16:20 - 19:53 - Introduction for all ages Fire doors in a care home God as immense
20:03 - 22:46 - Hymn R&S 601 Christ is the world‚Äôs true light Tune: 72 Nun danket
22:50 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing ‚Äì the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
23:15 - 24:25 - Readings: Revelation 12 vv 1 ‚Äì 5a read by Alan Yates
24:43 Hymn - R&S 332 Jesus lover of my soul
29:10 - 38:38 - Address Reflecting on school days and strict teachers like the headmaster who also served in church. The Bible passage about Jesus' teaching makes us think about impactful teachers. Jesus taught with authority unlike the rabbis who referenced earlier teachings. Jesus was confident in his identity as God's Son which integrated his character and teaching. We should also be ready to give account of our hope without just appealing to the past. Jesus' words had immediate impact, like healing the man. His message was freedom. Jesus walked the walk, not just talked. We should have integrating words and actions. Jesus earned authority by freeing and helping people, not from any office. We need to know our beloved identity in Christ through baptism and worship. Our everyday words and actions should bring God's kingdom like Jesus did. We are reminded to internalize our Christian identity so that our actions align with our words in bringing positive change, rather than relying solely on past teaching.
39:14 - 42:59 - Hymn - R&S 734 I‚Äôll praise my maker while I‚Äôve breath
43:03 - 48:50 - Prayers of intercession
49:07 - 52:44 - Hymn - R&S 104 Praise my soul the king of heaven
52:45 - 53:06 - Blessing
53:36 - 56:51 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 21st January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications üîî when we post new services. - Like our services ‚ù§Ô∏è or leave a comment on your favourite ones. üôè - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. üîÑ
00:00:00 - Music before the service 07:43 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
07:53 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
09:37 - Call to worship
10:27 - 12:22 - Hymn - R&S 565 Jesus stand among us
12:25 - Prayer of adoration 14:17 - Lord‚Äôs Prayer
15:00 - 28:18 - Introduction for all ages: ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre welcome.‚Äô Material for the week prepared by Christians in Burkina Faso focused on the Good Samaritan parable and loving your neighbor. Burkina Faso is experiencing major unrest and terrorism, with over 2 million displaced people. Links to a couple previously held hostage there that we prayed for. The importance of welcoming others, like Abraham and Sarah showing hospitality to angel visitors. Ways to welcome include providing refreshments and making people comfortable.
28:48 - 30:05 - Reading: Genesis 18:1-8 Good News
WORSHIP SONGS 31:22 - MP 1221 Praise is rising 34:39 - MP 1046 Give thanks to the Lord our God and King
37:50 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing ‚Äì the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
39:08 - 40:26 - Reading: Psalm 138 NIVUK read by Kitty Bird
40:36 - Prayer of confession with the response Merciful God: forgive and heal us.
44:07 - 46:45 - Reading: Luke 10:25-37 NIVUK read by Larry Ogbewe
47:17 - Hymn - R&S 309 Spirit of the Living God move among us
48:33 - 01:00:32 - Address - The Transforming Power of Love for Neighbour The parable of the Good Samaritan teaches us the meaning of loving our neighbor The Good Samaritan went far beyond what was expected to care for the wounded stranger We should not just pass by those in need but stop and truly help Unity and reconciliation are needed in divided communities like Burkina Faso Christians there are working together across denominations to help displaced people We must have hope - "the moment of reconciliation will come" The command to love God and neighbor matters more than religious laws and debates We must move from seeing "neighbor" as a noun to becoming a neighbor through action We can collaborate to be Good Samaritans addressing desperation in our own communities Love never ends - it bears, believes, hopes and endures all things Jesus' parable of the Good Samaritan, focusing on the Samaritan's loving action towards the wounded stranger. This radical care for neighbor should inspire Christians today, even in divided communities, to work together in reconciliation and service.
01:00:33 - Affirmation of Love (verses from 1 Corinthians 13)
01:03:18 - 01:05:31 - Hymn - R&S 648 Jesu, Jesu fill us with your love
01:05:33 - 01:09:37 - Prayers of intercession with the response Fill us with your love: make us one in you.
01:10:57 - Closing Prayer (from the Daily Prayer for Christian Unity of the Chemin Neuf Community) Lord Jesus, who prayed that all might be one, we pray to you for the unity of all Christians, according to your will, according to your means. May your Spirit enable us to experience the suffering caused by division, to see our sin and to hope beyond all hope. Amen.
01:11:58 - 01:14:02 - Hymn R&S 647 In Christ there is no East or West
01:14:03 - 01:14:28 - Blessing
01:14:55 - 01:18:34 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 7th January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications üîî when we post new services. - Like our services ‚ù§Ô∏è or leave a comment on your favourite ones. üôè - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. üîÑ
Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
Call to worship
HYMN R&S 187 Worship the Lord
Prayer of approach
Introduction for all ages: ‚ÄòWell, that‚Äôs agreed.‚Äô
Prayer ‚ÄòAgreement to forgive‚Äô Lord, teach us to pray in spirit and in truth to love as you love us, to forgive as you forgive us, To seek your will and work for your kingdom Of peace and justice, kindness and compassion. Lord, teach us to truly pray: Lord‚Äôs Prayer
HYMN R&S 603 Lord for the years
Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing ‚Äì the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church. Introduction to the readings
Reading: Jeremiah 31.31 ‚Äì 34 NIVUK read by Elsje Hatton
Prayer: ‚ÄòSeeking God‚Äôs forgiveness‚Äô from Psalm 51 God, in your constant love, have mercy on me, ¬†¬†¬†¬† In your great compassion¬†blot out my transgressions. Wash away all my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin. Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me. Do not cast me from your presence or take your Holy Spirit from me. Restore to me the joy of your salvation and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me. You are God my Saviour, and I will sing of your righteousness. Open my lips, Lord, and my mouth will declare your praise. Glory to God in the highest And peace to his people on earth. Thanks be to God for his love beyond words. Amen.
Reading: John 15. 1 ‚Äì 10 NIVUK read by Tony Hatton
HYMN R&S 629 Make me a channel of your peace
Short Address
Prayer: ‚ÄòRenewing our agreement with God‚Äô Eternal God, Lord of heaven and earth, trusting in your great love for us and for the world, we offer our lives anew to you. We recommit ourselves to walk the Way of Jesus, to seek your will for our lives and for our world, to pray and work for your kingdom of justice and joy. By your Spirit, unite us and renew us, that we may be channels of your love and peace, through Jesus Christ our Saviour and Lord. Amen.
HYMN R&S 108 The love of God is broad like beach
Prayer: ‚ÄòThanksgiving to God‚Äô
Distribution of bread
SONG MP 792 You are the vine (sung seated)
Distribution of the wine (non-alcoholic grape juice)
Final prayer
HYMN R&S 463i Now let us from this table rise
Blessing

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 24th December 2023 - Christmas Eve
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications üîî when we post new services. - Like our services ‚ù§Ô∏è or leave a comment on your favourite ones. üôè - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. üîÑ
00:00:00 - Music before the service
Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
Short time of quiet to prepare for worship
Call to worship ‚Äì Lighting of the Advent Candles God of hope, come to us again, as we prepare to celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ. May the light of your love be born anew in us.
HYMN R&S 74 Praise to the Lord, the Almighty
Opening Prayers and the Lord‚Äôs Prayer Introduction to the theme: ‚ÄòInteresting times‚Äô
HYMN R&S 274 God is love, his the care
Offering Prayer ‚Äì offering our thanks, gifts and prayers Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing ‚Äì the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at the back of church.
Introduction to Bible readings
Readings: 2 Samuel 7. 1 ‚Äì 11 and 16 read by Rosemary Taylor
Luke 1. 26 ‚Äì 38 read by Kate Yates
HYMN RAS 740 Tell out my soul. (Tune Woodlands)
Sermon (followed by time of quiet reflection)
HYMN R&S 614 Love came down at Christmas
Prayers for us and for the world
HYMN R&S 192 Thou didst leave thy throne
01:02:26 - 01:03:12 - Blessing
